focalPoint.title: Focal point
focalPoint.description:
Point on the image that is considered to be the focal point of the image.

If not present, 50 can be used for both `x` and `y`.

authorLine.description:
For example:
  - Ian T Baldwin
  - Randy Schekman, Mark Patterson
  - Lee R Berger et al

published.description:
Date and time this article was first published.
Not present if 'stage' is 'preview' and version is '1'.
published.title: Date-time ISO8601 with numeric UTC timezone

versionDate.description:
Date and time this version of the article was published.
Only present if 'stage' is 'published'.

statusDate.description:
Date and time this article transitioned to current status.
Not present if 'stage' is 'preview' and version is '1'.

equalContributionGroups.title: Equal contribution group IDs
equalContributionGroups.description:
Authors that contribute equally are linked together through a generated ID.

IDs will only be included if it is shared between two or more authors.

items.title: Phone number
items.description:
Phone number in E.164 format.

For example:
  - +447700900415
  - +12025550182;ext=555

deceased.description: Whether the person was deceased when the article was published.

preferred.title: Preferred name
preferred.description:
This is generally the name that is used by the person for English-language publications.

For example:
  - Randy Schekman
  - K. VijayRaghavan
  - Li Wenhui

index.title: Index name
index.description:
This is the name that should be used for indexing people.

For example:
  - Schekman, Randy
  - VijayRaghavan, Krishnaswamy
  - Li Wenhui

date.title: Partial date
date.description:
A date, where the month and/or day may not be known/available.

For example:
  - 2016
  - 2016-09
  - 2016-09-16

discriminator.description:
If the first author of a reference has two or more references published in the same year in the same
list, this property will be a letter (starting at 'a') that can be used to distinguish between them.

For example, 'John Smith, 2016a' and 'John Smith, 2016b' would refer to two references, one with the
year discriminator 'a' and a second with 'b'.

first.title: First page
first.description:
Page number on which the work starts.

For example:
  - 8
  - D760
  - xii

last.title: Last page
last.description:
Page number on which the work ends. If the work is only on one page, this will be the same as `first`.

For example:
  - 8
  - D714
  - xiii

range.title: Page ranges
range.description:
Complete page range information for the work. Contains one or more comma-seperated page ranges.

`first` contains the first value, `last` the final value.

For example:
  - 8
  - D706D714
  - 811, 1419, 40

language.title: Language name
language.description:
For example:
  - Python
  - Java
  - PHP
  - JavaScript

code.title: Code
code.description: Code, contain nessecary indentation and line breaks.
